text: hello everyone welcome back to the next
lecture in the computer Network series
and today we will see the various
network devices we will start with
outcomes now in today's session we have
only one outcome upon the completion of
the session the learner will be able to
list various networking devices let's
see what are the various networking
devices available we know there are n
devices and intermediary devices or
networking devices in a computer network
we have already seen elaborately about
n devices nava will focus on the various
networking devices the first networking
device that we would like to address is
the repeater a repeater is a layer 1
device it means it operates at physical
layer it just regenerates the signal in
a single local area network second
networking device is the hub a hub base
a local area network device it operates
at physical layer that is it is a layer
1 device and whatever it receives it
always does broadcasting and that is the
track of a hub and coming to the third
networking device which is the switch a
switch is also a local area networking
device and it connects devices in a
single local area network it is a layer
2 device and it operates at data link
layer which is an intelligent device it
stores the MAC address table
unlike hub switch thus unicasting it
means it can send the data to the exact
recipient where as have brought us the
data to all the recipients and coming to
the fourth networking device which is
the bridge a bridge is also a layer 2
device it operates at the data link
layer a bridge connects to local area
network segments that are running with
the same protocols a bridge can also
regenerate the signals because a bridge
is a combination of a repeater and MAC
address reading capability coming to the
next networking device which is the
router a router is a layer 3 device it
operates at the network layer routers
take forwarding decisions based on the
IP addresses and router is a networking
device that can connect two or more
different LANs that ask two or more
different protocols so one side if it is
a tonight another side if it is Wi-Fi
and router can connect these two
different technologies as
and coming to the sixth networking
device which is a multi-layer switch or
a layer 3 switch generally switches are
layer to switch it means it works at the
data link layer and it takes forwarding
decisions based on mac addresses we have
a contemporary switch which is some
multi-layer switch it can be a layer to
switch as well as layer 3 switch so it
does the functionalities of a switch as
well as the functionalities of a router
to some extent so multi-layer switch or
a layer 3 switch can act as a router as
well as a switch and coming to the next
networking device which is a broader a
broader is a combination of a bridge as
well as a router a bridge can connect to
different LAN segments of same protocol
a router can connect two or more
different protocols but brohter is a
combination of a bridge as well as a
router it means it can act as a layer to
bridge or it can act as a layer
three-rotor
and coming to the next networking device
it is the modem modem means modulator
and demodulator modulator means the
digital information is going to be
carried on ur analog carrier signal and
demodulator just retrace the transmitted
signal that is the transmitter digital
information for example in a traditional
landline phones that is exclusively for
carrying the voice signals that is the
analog signals but we can send our
digital information using modem so modem
does both modulation as well as
demodulation tasks and coming to the
last networking device that is the
firewall this firewall is a networking
device only but still it is mainly used
for providing security to the network
for example if we deploy a firewall in
our campus or in our network this
firewall filters the packet it filters
the packets based on the IP addresses
based on port numbers based on the
application data in a network you don't
want any malicious things to happen so
you can protect your network by
installing a firewall so in a network a
firewall filters the incoming traffic as
well as the outgoing traffic and that's
it we have listed various network
devices repeater hubs switches bridges
routers multi-layer switches or layer 3
switch routers modem firewall
and that's it guys I hope now you will
be able to list various networking
devices thank you
